div.div:
docs: Create LICENSE
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

docs: revise the project README to improve clarity and learning guidance
- Mark all frontend development tasks in the TODO instructions as completed. - Revise the project README to improve clarity and learning guidance, including renaming the project and reorganizing sections. - Add detailed explanations and learning tips for frontend and backend technologies, project structure, and API usage. - Update technical details such as API endpoints, database connection strings, and external weather API integration info. - Clarify project limitations and suggest advanced features for learners to explore after completing the basics. - Provide a recommended step-by-step learning workflow and relevant external learning resources.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

chore: update footer copyright and source link to official data platform
- Update footer copyright to include author name and link to Central Weather Bureau open data platform.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

fix: handle 204 No Content responses gracefully in API calls
- Add handling for 204 No Content responses by returning early without parsing JSON - Keep existing error handling and response status checks intact
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: display detailed multi-metric weather charts on forecast page
- Add Chart.js library to the HTML to enable chart rendering. - Replace the previous city info display with a layout that includes four line charts for temperature, humidity, wind speed, and rain probability. - Implement line charts for temperature, humidity, wind speed, and rain probability using Chart.js with appropriate labels, colors, and axis titles. - Remove the display of individual forecast cards in favor of graphical visualization.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: add frontend UI and API integration for weather and city management
- Add frontend files including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to provide a weather forecast UI with city management and weather display features. - Implement a new API service class in JavaScript to handle backend API interactions for cities and weather data. - Create city management module for rendering, adding, selecting, and deleting cities with UI updates and API calls. - Develop weather forecast module to fetch and display weather data with loading states, error handling, and weather icons based on conditions. - Modify the server program to redirect the root URL to the frontend index page and preserve the Swagger UI route. - Update .gitignore to include SQLite database auxiliary files for WeatherForecast.db.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: remove obsolete LocationId and add forecast Id to Weather DTOs
- Add an Id property to WeatherForecastDto and populate it in the WeatherController. - Remove the LocationId property from WeatherForecastDto and its assignment in the controller.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: remove no-op authentication handler to simplify security setup
- Remove the NoAuthHandler authentication handler and its related configuration. - Eliminate the authentication and authorization middleware from the application pipeline. - Simplify the startup by no longer setting up a default authentication scheme that bypasses actual authentication.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: consolidate city and weather HTTP requests into main file
- Move all city and weather API request examples from cities.http into WeatherForecastHub.http - Remove the locationId field from city create and update request examples - Delete the redundant cities.http file - Rename the host address variable for consistency
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: implement backend API and database for managing cities and fetching weather forecasts
- Add detailed multi-phase development plan and instructions for a weather forecast POC project, covering backend setup, database, API implementation, frontend development, testing, and deployment - Refactor logging calls across controllers, repositories, and services to use explicit named parameters for better clarity - Improve code formatting and variable typing in CitiesController and WeatherController for consistency - Introduce comprehensive DTO classes for parsing Central Weather Agency (CWA) API responses - Replace old CwbApiModels service code with updated, detailed models reflecting actual CWA API structure - Update WeatherService to use IHttpClientFactory with named HttpClient, improving API request handling and response parsing - Enhance weather data parsing logic to correctly extract multiple weather elements and time points from API response - Modify WeatherData and WeatherForecastDto models to unify date/time handling with a single DateTime property named Datetime - Configure HttpClient in Program.cs with base address and JSON headers using appsettings configuration for CWA API - Ensure database context and EF Core setup support SQLite with appropriate constructors and DbSet properties - Add richer project documentation and instructions, including API paths, frontend/backend architecture, data models, and external API integration details - Include static files and API routing configurations to serve frontend assets and unify API under /api path - Remove unused or outdated code files related to CwbApiModels service - Add project files and instructions to .csproj for better project management and documentation integration
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

refactor: remove LocationId from city data and update weather API usage
- Remove the LocationId property from City model, DTOs, database context, and related code. - Update CitiesController to no longer handle LocationId when creating, updating, or returning city data. - Modify CityService and CityRepository to remove validation and assignment of LocationId. - Change WeatherService to fetch weather data using city name instead of LocationId and adjust related API request and data processing accordingly. - Add a new migration to drop the LocationId column from the Cities table.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

chore: enable user secrets and configure IDE settings for WeatherForecastHub
- Add IntelliJ IDEA project configuration files and a .gitignore for IDE-specific files to the repository. - Update project file to target .NET 9.0 and enable nullable reference types and implicit usings. - Add UserSecretsId to the project for managing user secrets securely. - Include package references for OpenAPI support, SQLite database, and Entity Framework Core with version 9.0.4.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: ensure database and tables exist at app startup
- Add code to ensure the database and tables are created at application startup.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

chore: ignore WeatherForecast database file to prevent commits
- Add WeatherForecast.db to the .gitignore file to exclude it from version control
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: add no-op authentication handler to bypass auth errors
- Add WeatherForecast.db to the .gitignore to exclude the database file from version control - Introduce a NoAuthHandler authentication scheme that always succeeds without actual authentication, preventing authentication-related exceptions - Configure the application to use the NoAuth authentication scheme by default without enforcing authorization on controllers - Update the HTTP request testing host URL from HTTPS on port 7173 to HTTP on port 5105
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: implement city management and weather forecast APIs with full CRUD and external data integration
- Complete all backend tasks for city and weather data management, including repository, service, and controller layers. - Remove the previous WeatherForecastController and replace it with focused CitiesController and WeatherController implementations. - Implement full CRUD operations for managing cities via CitiesController with validation and error handling. - Add WeatherController to fetch weather forecasts for a given city, integrating with the Central Weather Bureau API. - Define DTO classes for city and weather data to structure API input/output. - Create repository and service layers for city data with logging and validation. - Implement WeatherService to retrieve and parse weather data from the external API, including error handling and logging. - Register repositories, services, and HttpClient in the application’s dependency injection container. - Add HTTP request examples for all city and weather-related API endpoints in a new cities.http file.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>

feat: initialize .NET 9 API with EF Core and Swagger setup
- Add .gitattributes to enforce consistent line endings for different file types and mark binary files - Complete initial backend setup tasks in TODO instructions, marking them as done - Prefix WeatherForecastController route with "/api" and add response type annotation for GET endpoint - Implement WeatherDbContext with DbSet for City and configure SQLite database and entity model - Add City model with Id, Name, and LocationId properties - Configure Program.cs to use SQLite database, enable lowercase URLs, serve static files, set API route prefix to "/api", require authorization on controllers, and redirect root to Swagger UI - Update project dependencies to include Microsoft.Data.Sqlite and Swashbuckle.AspNetCore packages with specific versions - Add Entity Framework Core initial migration files to create Cities table with Id, Name, and LocationId columns
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>
設定專案結構與資料庫連接

新增 GlobalUsings.cs、.gitignore、.gitattributes 和 .editorconfig 檔案
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>
# Conflicts: # .gitignore
安裝 Entity Framework Core 相關套件和 EF Core Power Tools CLI
初始化 Web API 專案

docs: rename and add GitHub instructions
- Rename and restructure prompt files under .github/prompts to .github/instructions for better organization. - Add detailed instructions for initializing a C# .NET 9 Web API project, including environment setup, EF Core installation, global usings, and git configuration. - Provide step-by-step guide on creating API controllers with best practices for DI, DTO usage, OpenAPI annotations, and testing. - Introduce instructions for generating .gitignore files using templates and curl commands. - Add guidance for initializing EF Core DbContext using EF Core Power Tools with build verification. - Add comprehensive web design guidelines focusing on simplicity, responsiveness, Tailwind CSS usage, semantic HTML, accessibility, and modular VanillaJS implementation with example code.
Signed-off-by: CHEN, CHUN <jim60105@gmail.com>
